column4: U.S. court revives Microsoft co-founder's patent suit vs tech companies
column5: A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday revived part of a patent lawsuit brought by Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen against AOL  Apple  Google and Yahoo  saying a lower court incorrectly found that the tech companies didn't infringe one of its patents.

column4: Google buys high-tech spoon maker  expands healthcare focus
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc has acquired the maker of a high-tech spoon that helps people suffering from neurodegenerative tremors to eat  the Internet company's latest foray into the healthcare and biotechnology market.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-Danish reformer gets EU antitrust stick; German to police the Internet
column5: BRUSSELS  Sept 10 Europe's incoming competition and telecoms chiefs will have their plates full for the next five years as one tackles global companies suspected of acting unfairly while the other seeks to keep the Internet open and let online services flow freely.

column4: EU's Almunia says won't finish Google probe before end-October

column4: Brazil confirms Amazon deforestation sped up in 2013
column5: SAO PAULO The destruction of the world's largest rainforest accelerated last year with a 29 percent spike in deforestation  according to final figures released by the Brazilian government on Wednesday that confirmed a reversal in gains seen since 2009.

column4: Brazil confirms Amazon deforestation sped up in 2013
column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 10 The destruction of the world's largest rainforest accelerated last year with a 29 percent spike in deforestation  according to final figures released by the Brazilian government on Wednesday that confirmed a reversal in gains seen since 2009.

column4: RadioShack plunges after brokerage cuts price target to $0
column5: Troubled electronics retailer RadioShack Corp's shares have lost nearly a third of their value since brokerage Wedbush Securities said on Tuesday the company could file for bankruptcy soon  making the stock worthless by the end of this year.

column4: RadioShack plunges after brokerage cuts price target to $0
column5: Sept 10 Troubled electronics retailer RadioShack Corp's shares have lost nearly a third of their value since brokerage Wedbush Securities said on Tuesday the company could file for bankruptcy soon  making the stock worthless by the end of this year.

column4: Rocket's $6.5 billion float plan joins e-commerce listings rush
column5: BERLIN German venture capital firm Rocket Internet unveiled plans for a stock market listing that could value the company behind dozens of online start-ups at $6.5 billion  riding a wave of e-commerce flotations.

column4: In search of the missing 'i' in Apple's Watch
column5: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Apple Inc's Tuesday launch was a marketing extravaganza stuffed full of gadgets  corporate hyperbole and celebrities of every stripe. One thing was missing: the "i" in front of the Watch.

column4: U.S. stocks rise on Apple; rate hike views boost dollar
column5: NEW YORK U.S. stocks rose on Wednesday  helped by a rebound in Apple shares  while expectations for a stronger economy and thus higher interest rates from the Federal Reserve boosted the dollar to a six-year high against the yen.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St ends higher after 2 days of losses as Apple rebounds
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 10 A rebound in Apple  shares helped push U.S. stocks higher on Wednesday  breaking the market's two-day string of losses.

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Apple leads market higher  energy weighs
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 10 A rebound in Apple  shares helped push U.S. stocks higher on Wednesday for the first session in three  while the energy sector lagged as crude prices fell.

column4: Retailers seen unlikely to warm up to Apple Pay
column5: Apple Inc's launch of its own tap-to-pay system using near-field communication in its new iPhones and smartwatches may not be a game changer after all.

column5: JOHANNESBURG  Sept 10 Aspen Pharmacare  is to sell the rights to market a blood clot drug in the United States to rival Mylan Inc for up to $300 million  it said on Wednesday  a move that would help Africa's top generic drugmaker pay down debt.

column4: Genmab and Seattle Genetics in antibody drug agreement
column5: COPENHAGEN  Sept 10 Denmark's Genmab  will pay Seattle Genetics $11 million to use its technology with Genmab's AXL antibody and future milestones and royalty payments  as a result of a potential product  could amount to $200 million  the companies said on Tuesday.

column4: Nevada lawmakers to consider huge tax breaks for Tesla
column5: CARSON CITY Nev. Nevada lawmakers on Wednesday will consider controversial tax breaks estimated at up to $1.3 billion for Tesla Motors Inc to build its $5 billion battery factory in the state.

column5: CARSON CITY Nev. Nevada lawmakers are set to convene a special legislative session in Carson City on Wednesday to consider a package of tax breaks estimated at up to $1.3 billion aimed at cementing a deal with Tesla Motors Inc  for a $5 billion battery plant.

column4: U.S. SEC charges corporate insiders with disclosure violations
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 10 U.S. securities regulators filed civil charges on Wednesday against 28 officers  directors and major company shareholders as part of a crackdown on improper disclosures about their stock holdings.

column4: Ackman urges Allergan board to 'wake up' on Valeant talks
column5: BOSTON After months of staying largely silent on a deal he is trying to broker  billionaire William Ackman on Tuesday criticized Allergan Inc 's  board of directors  urging them to "wake up" and at least listen to what potential purchaser Valeant Pharmaceuticals  has to offer the Botox maker.

column4: UPDATE 1-Ackman urges Allergan board to 'wake up' on Valeant talks

column4: Fitch Affirms AmerisourceBergen at 'A-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  September 10 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the long-term ratings  of AmerisourceBergen Corp. (NYSE: ABC) at 'A-' and the short-term ratings at  'F2'. The Rating Outlook is Stable. The rating actions apply to approximately $2 billion of debt at June 30  2014. A  full list of rating actions follows at the end of this release. KEY RATING DRIVERS -- U.S. drug distributors maintain stable operating profiles due to the  industry

column4: US STOCKS-Anglogold Ashanti shares drop 16 pct; miners weigh on ADR index
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 10 U.S.-listed shares of South African gold miner AngloGold Ashanti Ltd were among the biggest percentage decliners on the New York Stock Exchange Wednesday after it announced a $2.1 billion rights issue and plans to spin off its non-South African assets in a new British-based company.

column4: South Africa's AngloGold plans London listing for international operations
column5: JOHANNESBURG/LONDON Africa's biggest bullion producer AngloGold Ashanti is to restructure its mining and exploration operations outside South Africa under a new British-based company and aims to raise $2.1 billion in a rights issue.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX falls as energy shares slide with oil price
column5: * TSX down 51.26 points  or 0.33 percent  at 15 485.55     * Six of the 10 main index sectors decline     * Suncor  Canadian Natural follow oil price lower      By John Tilak     TORONTO  Sept 10 Canada's main stock index dropped on Wednesday as worries that U.S. interest rates might rise weighed on sentiment and lower oil prices dragged down shares of energy companies.     Concerns about the Scottish referendum on independence  which is set for next week  further dampened the mood.

column4: Home Depot sued by customer over data breach
column5: Home improvement retailer Home Depot Inc  has been sued over data breach by a customer  saying the company failed to properly safeguard customer data from hackers  a lawsuit filed in a Chicago federal court showed on Tuesday.

column4: Spain's Telefonica to issue 1.5 billion euros in bonds
column5: MADRID  Sept 10 Spanish telecoms group Telefonica on Wednesday said it would issue 1.5 billion euros (1.94 billion US dollar) in bonds maturing in three years and carrying an annual coupon of between 4.5 percent and 5 percent.

column4: Wal-Mart joins U.S. crop-tour fever seeking food chain edge
column5: CHICAGO Retail giant Wal-Mart joined a group of volunteers counting corn ears and soybean pods in fields in the United States recently in a clear sign traditional crop tours are expanding their appeal from farmers and traders to all those with a stake in the U.S. food chain.

column4: Maker Studios viewers hip jumps after Disney purchase
column5: LOS ANGELES Monthly viewers hip of videos from Maker Studios more than doubled to 9 billion after Walt Disney Co purchased the multichannel network in May  Disney Chief Financial Officer Jay Rasulo said on Wednesday.

column4: Maker Studios viewership jumps after Disney purchase
column5: LOS ANGELES  Sept 10 Monthly viewership of videos from Maker Studios more than doubled to 9 billion after Walt Disney Co purchased the multichannel network in May  Disney Chief Financial Officer Jay Rasulo said on Wednesday.

column4: BRIEF-Wells Fargo's mortgage lending to stabilize: CFO
column5: Sept 10 Wells Fargo & Co chief financial officer John Shrewsberry said at a Wednesday investor conference in New York:  * Wells Fargo's third-quarter 2014 mortgage lending is expected to be in line with second-quarter volumes  * Wells Fargo's third-quarter 2014 mortgage gain on sale margins expected to be within range of last four quarters  * Wells Fargo is already meeting requirements for liquidity coverage ratio  * Wells Fargo's share count expected to fall in the third quarter  *

column4: Former professional wrestler dies in South Carolina
column5: Former World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) professional wrestler Sean O'Haire died at his home earlier this week in South Carolina  the Spartanburg County Coroner's Office said on Wednesday. He was 43.

column4: U.S. SEC charges corporate insiders with disclosure violations
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 10 U.S. securities regulators filed civil charges on Wednesday against 28 officers  directors and major company shareholders as part of a crackdown on improper disclosures about their stock holdings.
